summary: Rajendra Simha calls Ikram at RTC and requests a complaint for a faulty product he received. Ikram puts Rajendra on hold in order to switch him to the concerned agent, John. Rajendra continues his complaint, specifying that the biscuits are too soft and not crispy, as they should be, and that he has been a consumer of this product for the past 5 to 6 months since he switched from a different brand. John takes down Rajendra's address: H503, Sriram Lakshar, Luxur, Lakshar, and informs him that they will inform the store team of his feedback. Rajendra's complaint is then concluded.
cohere_points:
- Ikram puts Rajendra Simha on hold to check on his complaint regarding Mary Light Biscuits being too soft
- Ikram transfers Rajendra to a suitable agent named John
- John gathers information regarding the complaint and stores he purchased the product from 
- Rajendra has purchased the product for 5-6 months since switching from Britannia Marie 
- Rajendra provides his full address for contact reasons
- Rajendra informs John he discarded the product but sent a photograph of it prior 
- John assures Rajendra his feedback will be shared with the store team and there is nothing else that can be done
